results.title: Games and pastimes
results.brief_description: Top spinning competitions; kiteflying - often with elaborately painted kites; a type of football played with a woven cane ball; a form of self-defence, once serious and now a sport; traditional dances and new dances in traditional style; all a part of the leisure of Malayans, young and old.

results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: Colin Pym and SMS Audio Visual
results.brief_description: Australian Rules football is uniquely Australian. Six champion players demonstrate the basic skills and techniques of the game. Includes scenes from the 1977 grand finals in Victoria, South Australia and Western Australia. Features VFL football players Barry Cable, Russel Ebert, Bill Gallagher, Peter Knights, Graham Moss, Kevin Sheedy.

results.title: Game in 21 points
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bobet, Clement Perron and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Ping-Pong between two international champions, Denis Neale of Great Britain, and Jaroslav Stanek of Czechoslovakia. In this demonstration match the camera plays its own part in the action, often showing front-face views of the players simultaneously so that their amazing virtuosity and most telling shots may be observed without interruption. It is a sports film with a difference, and one that will prove as instructive to those already adept at the game as to novices. No spoken commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques Bobet, Clement Perron and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Game hunting in the Arctic Regions (D)
results.brief_description: A silent documentary film with English subtitles, about an arctic sea voyage and game hunting in the north of Norway, and around Spitzbergen and Bear Island. WARNING: CONTAINS IMAGES OF DYING ANIMALS, BUTCHERING CARCASES AND CAGING WHICH MAY DISTURB SOME VIEWERS.

results.title: Galvani and Volta: an early debate in science)
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: Reviews Volta and Galvani’s early experiments in electro-chemistry. Uses experiments recreated in the physics laboratories in the University of Rome, the artifacts of Galvani’s and Volta’s laboratories, and the sketches and notes of their experiments to chronicle the great debate of Galvani and Volta on animal electricity vs bi-metallic electricity.
results.title_for_label: Galvani and Volta: an early debate in science)

results.title: The Gallant little tailor
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, Carl Koch, Louis Hagan, Vivian Milroy and Primrose Productions
results.brief_description: A little tailor, plagued by flies kills seven of them at one stroke. Pleased with his exploit, he embroiders on his belt the words ‘Seven at one stroke’. When people read this he is taken for a great hero and sent to fight the giants. By trickery he manages to capture two of the giants and leads them back to the town, where he marries the King’s daughter. Music by Freddie Phillips.

results.title: Galileo: the challenge of reason
results.creator_credit: Dennis Azzarella and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Examines the life of Galileo, humanist and founder of modern experimental science, who, because of his unorthodox belief, was brought to trial before the Inquisition in 1632. It establishes a contemporary theme in the confrontation between an individual and the Establishment.

results.title: Gale is dead [B&W]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Gale was 19, beautiful, intelligent, had much to offer and everything to live for. However she was a drug addict, and was recently found dead. She had been shifted in and out of 14 institutions throughout her life and believed no-one cared for her. Reporter Harold Williamson talks to people in Gale’s life and the film asks if Gale need have died, and tries to show that there may be other Gales for whom it is not too late to help. Letters read by Anna Frankel.

results.title: The Galaxy in the sea
results.creator_credit: Dietmar Fill, Don Murray, George Hart, Klaus Jaritz and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A microscopic look at the Barrier Reef. Shows many of the 350 species of coral plus a variety of fish, sea slugs, and the fascinating Spanish Dancer.

results.title: Galaxy
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film using firework images, sometimes superimposed and sometimes in very soft focus. The mystery of outer space is evoked, its blackness broken by shooting stars and meteor trails, gaseous clouds and solar configurations. The sound track has reversed and slowed down triangle and cymbals added to an accelerated piano and xylophone.
